speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
line: Danelle was an outstanding high school basketball player...

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Come on, man. Come on. Come on, now. Put ‘em down … put ‘em down! Ow!

speaker: UPSHAW
line: Hey, man, watch it.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Come on, Upshaw. Come on, you and me, buddy! Let’s go!

speaker: UPSHAW
line: You’re a moron, Tiernan.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Come on. Let’s go!

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: You’re both morons, as far as I’m concerned. Now who’s watching the floor?

speaker: UPSHAW
line: What’s his name, the Skink.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Guess who died this afternoon? Mrs. Richardson.

speaker: UPSHAW
line: Face plant, in a bowl of pudding.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: I don’t suppose either of you changed her room.

speaker: UPSHAW
line: Oh, no. We left that for you.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Ow!

speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
line: Mike Tyson, a disciple of Costanaro …

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Okay. Party’s over, gents.

speaker: STAN
line: Why’d you do that?

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: ‘Cause rules are rules, Stan. And I’m the Queen Bitch around here.

speaker: HAL
line: Gung said we could watch the rest of the fight.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Well, do I look like Gung to you?

speaker: HAL
line: No. You got a better figure.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: You want to keep that hand, Hal, you better let go.

speaker: HAL
line: How about a little sponge bath?

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: How about I take care of these wandering hands of yours? Come here.

speaker: HAL
line: You like strapping me down, don’t you?

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Oh, yeah. I really get off on it.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Hey, Gung. No TV after 9:00. Do you understand?

speaker: GUNG
line: Dr. Grago said they’re getting better so …

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Oh, getting better. Right. That’s because they don’t pinch his butt every time he walks into the room.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: No! Somebody help me! Somebody, please! Please! Please! Please!

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Help me! Please, help me!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good morning.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever tape you found in that VCR, it isn’t mine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good. Because I put it back in that drawer with all those other videos that aren’t yours.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, this definitely isn’t mine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. This is Michelle Charters. She’s a registered nurse at a convalescent home in Worchester, Massachusetts.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened to her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: According to Miss Charters, she was raped. The abrasions and contusions here would be consistent with her claims as would be the medical report which cites the kind of injury and tearing associated with sexual trauma.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where did you get this? Violent Crimes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. The woman made the video herself. It seems that no one will believe her story.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because she claims to have been raped by an invisible entity. A spirit being.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have several X-Files that document similar cases.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know. I’ve been here since 6:00 this morning going through them.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then you none of them have ever been substantiated.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not surprisingly.

speaker: MULDER
line: Given the emotional and psychological violence of rape, the face or identity of the attacker is often blurred or erased from memory. That he could be perceived as invisible is a logical leap for me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. But this case is different.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The victim has filed a lawsuit against the government. She seems to be certain who the spirit being is.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Mr. Arden. Hal Arden.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you know him …?

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: He’s been a patient where I work for about five years.

speaker: MULDER
line: Miss Charters, the facts of your case seem to contravene those of other cases we have on file.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Right. You mean the other Woman-Raped-by-Invisible-Man cases?

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know it was him who attacked you?

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: He made advances toward me. And he said things – rude things. Look, when you bathe somebody every day for five years you get to know more about them than you really need to. And an old man smells a certain way and he feels a certain way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know this is hard for you.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: This is the easy part. You see, hard is not being able to get disability leave or workman’s comp and having to go back to work with this … guy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: To continue our investigation we’re going to need some kind of evidence – physical or …

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Yeah, I know. I’ve heard it. Unless you have hair or semen or fibers you guys can’t build a case.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s right.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Look, I didn’t make this up, okay? I was attacked. And I’m not some kind of shrinking violet who would repress the memory of a rapist’s face. If I could positively ID him or give you something to incriminate the man, I would.

speaker: HAL
line: You’ve got to be kidding me. And what do I think about her claims? I should be in the Guinness Record Book. I’m 74 years old. I’ve got plumbing older than this building. Hmmm?

speaker: HAL
line: And it don’t work much better, either.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you for sharing. Are you aware you’re being named in a lawsuit against the federal government?

speaker: HAL
line: I am?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you ever threaten Miss Charters?

speaker: HAL
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you ever threaten Miss Charters?

speaker: HAL
line: Threaten? It was harmless, for crying out loud. Ever since this *sex harassment* fad, men can’t say what’s on their minds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She says you made advances.

speaker: HAL
line: Hmm?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Advances?

speaker: HAL
line: If I told you you were a very pretty woman and I would like to show you some affection, would you be offended? Huh?

speaker: HAL
line: Oh, I didn’t mean to step on your toes there.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s all right. There seems to be some confusion here.

speaker: HAL
line: Yeah. I though Nurse What’s-Her-Name said she was rogered by a ghost. I may have one foot in the grave, but I certainly can’t fly down hallways spreading amour.

speaker: MULDER
line: Apparently not.

speaker: HAL
line: If that’s what it’s like … if that’s what it’s like in heaven, Lord, take me now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: About the guy’s plumbing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: About his story.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think this will turn out to be a huge waste of time just like all the other X-Files on entity rape. Unsubstantiated phenomena.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But in a substantiated crime.

speaker: UPSHAW
line: Hey, pay attention. Or you can take another bath with your clothes on. At five and a half bucks an hour I don’t give a rat's ass either way.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: Ten years ago, Excelsius was a leading facility in care and treatment of the elderly. Then government funding was cut till we’re all but shut down. Only a few wings are operational now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is there still a medical staff?

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: Not on site. Dr. Grego visits three times a week. Excelsius residents are very well looked after, though. We hold ourselves to a high standard of health maintenance and treatment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kind of treatment?

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: We’ve always specialized in the care of the late-life degenerative diseases – Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s.

speaker: MULDER
line: We met with a patient today.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: We prefer "resident," actually.

speaker: MULDER
line: We met a *resident* who was described to us as having Alzheimer’s but he actually seemed quite spry and alert.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: You’re speaking of Hal Arden, the man accused of assaulting Michelle Charters.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Was he receiving special treatment?

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: You’d have to speak to Dr. Grago. Hal has been here almost eight years now. We’re all quite fond of him. We were extremely dismayed over this whole business with the lawsuit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you saying you don’t believe Nurse Charters’ allegations of rape?

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: There’s something I’d like to show you.

speaker: STAN
line: What did you tell them?

speaker: HAL
line: I didn’t tell them anything.

speaker: STAN
line: Why are they still here?

speaker: HAL
line: I don’t know, Stan.

speaker: STAN
line: Now you got to be more careful.

speaker: HAL
line: I am careful.

speaker: STAN
line: You’re going to ruin it for all of us. They find out, it all goes for nothing.

speaker: HAL
line: I didn’t tell them anything.

speaker: STAN
line: I’m not going to die in this Godforsaken hole, you hear me?

speaker: HAL
line: Oh, bug off, Stan.

speaker: HAL
line: Where’d you get that?

speaker: STAN
line: I know where he keeps them.

speaker: HAL
line: Give me one, Stan. Huh? I want another one, too.

speaker: STAN
line: You can’t handle another one.

speaker: HAL
line: Oh yeah? Maybe I’ll just rat you out, then. Huh? How would you like that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is Michelle Charters’?

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: There are three separate insurance claims for accidents received on the job. In April, she went to the State Board and requested leave with full pay due to job-related emotional stress. The request was summarily rejected. There’s more …

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’d like to review it myself, if that’s okay?

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: Certainly.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ms. Dawson, did you get a chance to see Michelle after the incident? To see the extent of her injuries?

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: I wasn’t here the night it happened but I did see her the following day.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then you know how badly she was hurt.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: In your opinion, do you think she staged the attack?

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Excuse me, Ms. Dawson? We need help. Mr. Arden’s choking to death!

speaker: STAN
line: See? See what happened? I told you you couldn’t handle any more.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Call 911. Hal. Can you speak? I think this man’s in ventricular fibrillation. I need 75 milligrams of Lidocaine and one amp of Amphinephrine. Stat.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And get me a defibrillator!

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He’s turning cyanotic. Come on, Hal. You gotta help me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Hal.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: One, two, three, four, five.

speaker: UPSHAW
line: The ambulance is on the way!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m losing him. What’s taking them so long?

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: He’s not responding! Still no pulse. Where’s that crash cart!

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Hal Arden’s been my patient since he came here eight years ago. This really is a setback.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A setback?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Hal was part of a group of Alzheimer’s patients I’ve been treating for 11 months.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But Alzheimer’s isn’t treatable.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: It’s an experimental drug called Depranil – an enzyme inhibitor that increases the amount of acetylcholine in the brain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’ve read about it, but I’ve also read that the clinical benefits are marginal at best.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Yes, but these patients seem to be proving otherwise. They’ve demonstrated cognitive abilities well beyond anything that’s been reported.

speaker: MULDER
line: So he was actually getting better?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Before he started receiving the drug he could hardly complete a sentence.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Look, there’s not much to get excited about in my work. Most of these people are on the downhill slide. If I can make them comfortable, maybe prolong a life, that’s about all they expect. But to reverse an illness.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would it be possible for us to take a look at other patients in your test group?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Sure, if you want to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: GUNG
line: Where did you get that?

speaker: STAN
line: It was Hal’s. Since he’s not here anymore, why can’t I have it?

speaker: GUNG
line: Because you have enough. What I give you is enough. It’s our secret.

speaker: STAN
line: Oh, come on, Gung. It’s making me better.

speaker: GUNG
line: Too much is very bad Very bad. No more for you.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: I want you to stand behind Ben, Eddie, because Ben’s taller, and I want …

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: That man there --- that’s Leo Kreutzer. During the Depression he was a WPA artist. Quite a good one too, I’m told.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: …Hello, Mabel, don’t you look lovely. ….

speaker: MULDER
line: Is he receiving the same treatments as Hal Arden?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Yes. When he came to us he couldn’t draw a circle. Now, you can see for yourself.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: …Because you’re taller I want you to stand behind Ben.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: You’ll have to excuse me, I’m already well behind on rounds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can I get a copy of Hal Arden’s autopsy results?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Of course.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: May I sit down, Leo?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Leo, we’re with the FBI. We have some questions that we’d like to ask you.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: Leo’s a brilliant artist, you know. Don’t be so modest, Leo. President Kennedy has one of his paintings in the White House.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Grago tells us that you haven’t been able to work in years. That the medicine has improved …

speaker: LEO
line: It ain’t the medication.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it then?

speaker: UPSHAW
line: Okay, Rembrandt. 6:00. Dinner time.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Come on, Dorothy. Legs up and straight ahead. Don’t want you getting a flat tire.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: Wait, Leo’s not finished with us.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Leo can finish with you later.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: He still has to draw the rest.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: He’ll do it later, honey.

speaker: UPSHAW
line: Come on, Leo. Don’t make me embarrass you in front of your friends.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Scully. Let’s get out of here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: ….to find not just the treatment but a cure for Alzheimer’s. Do you realize how important that would be?

speaker: MULDER
line: If it would keep anybody out of a place like that it would be important enough. I wouldn’t say those people were exactly cured.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Any progress at all …

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I hope someone’s making some progress ‘cause we’re going home with a big goose egg. Checking out of room 206 and 210, please.

speaker: CLERK
line: Certainly, sir. Angelo?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What if there’s a connection?

speaker: MULDER
line: Between the rape case and the Alzheimer’s? When they’re not drawing childlike pictures they’re brutal sex offenders?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Grago’s therapy produces acetylcholine. Too much cholinergic activity causes a phychotic state similar to schizophrenia.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think that Michelle Charters was raped by an 74-year-old schizophrenic?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s possible.

speaker: MULDER
line: An *invisible* 74-year-old schizophrenic?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe it’s not in the medication. Maybe it’s the place itself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you saying that the building’s haunted? If you are, you’ve been working with me for too long, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m talking about an environmental reason behind what’s happening there. Even the disinfectant couldn’t mask that smell. Who knows what’s breeding behind the walls or in the sub-structure. Some fungal contaminants have been known to cause delusions, dementia, violent behaviour…

speaker: MULDER
line: Why wouldn’t it have affected the other residents?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe it has.

speaker: MULDER
line: I-I think you’re looking too hard, Scully, for something that’s not there. I think Michelle Charters concocted this story to get out of a job she hates.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Her lip required 13 stitches. The blow to her head resulted in a subdural hematoma. That’s quite a concoction. Look, I just want to talk to a few more patients there. We can catch the same flight out tomorrow night.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: This is gourmet fare. Be a good girl and open wide.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: No. Please don’t. Please, don’t.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Open wide. Open up, honey.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: Please don’t. I don’t want …

speaker: TIERNAN
line: That’s fine, Dorothy. Starve to death. See if I care.

speaker: GUNG
line: Why aren’t you eating your food, Leo? What’s the matter?

speaker: LEO
line: It’s Dorothy. She needs more. We both do.

speaker: GUNG
line: What you have is enough.

speaker: LEO
line: It’s not working for us. Not like it works for the others. We need more.

speaker: GUNG
line: No. No. Now eat your food, please. I’ll come back and pick up your tray.

speaker: LEO
line: It’s okay, Dorothy. Don’t worry. I think Stan had some more hidden away somewhere. It will be all right.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: Why are you being so stubborn?

speaker: STAN
line: I’m not. I happen to like it here.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: A year ago you were begging to live with us.

speaker: STAN
line: Well, things change.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: Look Dad, I am sorry about what happened to Mr. Arlen.

speaker: STAN
line: His name was Arden.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: I’m finished packing your things, Mr. Phillips. I’m going to make sure you didn’t forget anything. Don’t you worry, Mrs. Kelly. Just pull your car around out front. I’ll make sure he gets down okay.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: Thank you.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: He’s going to be fine.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: Can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. We’d like to have a word with Mr. Phillips.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: I’m his daughter. What is this about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We’re with the FBI. We have a few questions concerning his medical treatment.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: He’s in there packing right now. I’m about to take him home. Is there anything I can help you with?

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: My little girls won’t even visit their grandfather. They’re afraid to even come here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s hard for anyone to be here, including the residents.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: That’s why Jack and I decided that no matter what time he’s got left we want him to spend it with us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How many years has he been here?

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: Almost three. But we didn’t have any choice. Jack and I both work. The doctor said he needed 24 hour nursing assistance.

speaker: MULDER
line: He doesn’t seem to need much assistance now. Has his improvement been that pronounced?

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: I thought I was bringing him here to die. They told me he’d only get worse. The physical deterioration, the dementia. And now it’s like he’s a different person.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you have any idea why?

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: I suppose it has something to do with Dr. Grago’s treatment. Dad won’t talk to me about it. He’s just too angry. He was angry when I first brought him here in the first place. Now he’s angry that I want to take him home. I don’t know that he’s ever going to forgive me.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: You know, I’d like to say I’m going to miss you, Stan, but the truth is, you are a royal pain in the butt.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Hey, where you going? Don’t make me chase you, old man.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Hey! What are you? A track star all of a sudden? Okay, stop messing around, Stan. You crawl back in that window right now. You crawl back in there. Don’t think I’m coming over there to get you. I’d just as soon let you fall and break your neck. Did you hear me Stan? You hear me?

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Help! Help me! Somebody help me! I’m gonna fall!

speaker: TIERNAN
line: Help!

speaker: MULDER
line: Give me your hand. Come on.

speaker: TIERNAN
line: I can’t.

speaker: MULDER
line: Grab it.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: They paged me this morning. I got a message an orderly fell out a fourth floor window?

speaker: MULDER
line: Apparently. Either that or he was pushed.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Was Stan involved?

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s what we’re trying to determine. Stan was with him just prior to the accident.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: You’re not suggesting he could have done it.

speaker: MULDER
line: There have been two deaths here in the past 24 hours. Stan’s been present before both of them.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: No, no. That’s impossible. Stan Phillips has a degenerative hip disease. There’s no way, he couldn’t get up to the fourth floor on his own.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about an elevator?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: The elevators in this place haven’t worked for years.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe he was helped.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Helped? By whom?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know. The postmortem on Hal Arden – did you get it yet?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: No, not yet, but they promise they’ll fax it today.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can we check and see if it’s come in yet?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Sure. Just what do you expect to find?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not sure, exactly.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: Why are they questioning him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s routine procedure.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: Are they going to want to keep him here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’ll have to ask Dr. Grago.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: I … God. If my mother was alive …

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: How can I handle the whole floor by myself?

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: I don’t know, Michelle. I have other things to deal with.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Yes, well, so do I. I would just like some help, please.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: You’re the only one on?

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Yes. Upshaw never showed up for work last night. Nobody’s listening to me around here. I said there was something going on and I told you it had to do with Mr. Arden and Mr. Phillips. Forget it.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: Can you please explain to me what’s going on around here?

speaker: DOROTHY
line: Shoo! Shoo! Go away! Go away! Leave me alone. Go back! Don’t come any closer!

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: Go back in your room, Dorothy. If you need something, I’ll send an orderly to see you.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: No, they’re in there.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: Who?

speaker: DOROTHY
line: All of them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There’s nobody in your room, Dorothy.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: Here they come. You’ll see. All right, now you be nice. I don’t want any more of your dirty tricks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is she going to be all right?

speaker: DOROTHY
line: No! No, no, no, I don’t want to go back in there! No! No! I don’t want to go back in there! Oh, no, no, no …

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: It’s senile dementia. This is just an episode.

speaker: (DOROTHY’S POV ON SCULLY
line: SCULLY is surrounded by shadowy figures reaching out to touch her. SCULLY stands staring at DOROTHY.)

speaker: DOROTHY
line: You leave her be. Don’t you touch her. Now shoo! Go away, go away! Don’t you get any ideas, mister.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: Now don’t you follow her.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: This is it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is the toxicology there?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Yes. There’s something here that shouldn’t be here.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s that?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Ibotenic acid. How did that get in his blood?

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s ibotenic acid?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: If I’m not mistaken, it’s a kind of poison.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder …

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, Hal Arden had ibotenic acid in his blood. Somebody poisoned him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, not necessarily. This is only a trace amount but small amounts are known to cause hallucinations which is what one of your patients is having right now down the hall.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Where did they get it?

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Excuse me. You’ve got to come quickly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s fantastic.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: What’s going on here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Leo?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s incredible …

speaker: MULDER
line: You’ve got an Asian orderly working here. What’s his name?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Uh, Gung, I think.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know where he is?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Somewhere down in the basement.

speaker: MULDER
line: Upshaw.

speaker: GUNG
line: I didn’t kill him.

speaker: MULDER
line: But it’s your mushroom crop, isn’t it?

speaker: GUNG
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who else would have buried him there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why were you growing them?

speaker: GUNG
line: For medicinal purposes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Were you feeding them to the residents here?

speaker: GUNG
line: Yes, but only in small amounts.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: GUNG
line: Because it makes them feel better.

speaker: MULDER
line: Makes them feel better, or it kills them?

speaker: GUNG
line: No.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Exactly what kind of mushrooms are they?

speaker: GUNG
line: It’s from my prefecture in my country. They’ve been used for centuries.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For what purpose?

speaker: GUNG
line: In my country, our customs are different.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: You’re not in your country now. You’re hired here to care for these people under our guidelines.

speaker: GUNG
line: Where I come from, many generations live under one roof. As children, our grandparents live with us. We feel a duty to take care of them. It isn’t like that in this country. We respect our old people as we respect our ancestors. We don’t send them away to die like Stan and Hal.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: These people are given excellent medical care.

speaker: GUNG
line: But they’re not treated with respect. Hal’s family never came to visit him once and the orderlies … treat the residents worse than dogs.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: No one is mistreated here.

speaker: GUNG
line: You’re not here to see.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, Gung, who killed the orderly? Who buried him in that room?

speaker: GUNG
line: Something has gone very wrong. The mushrooms we take to speak with the dead, to see our ancestors in the spirit world. But … the spirit in this place is very angry and the souls that died here continue to suffer. And now they … have been awakened.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you saying that a spirit killed this man, Upshaw?

speaker: GUNG
line: Yes. They’ve taken revenge for their mistreatment.

speaker: MULDER
line: How are the mushrooms taken?

speaker: GUNG
line: Dried, mixed with many herbs, made into powder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I think the first thing we should do is make sure nobody else takes them. You, check on the other patients. Gung, come with me. Let’s go.

speaker: GUNG
line: Someone’s taken them all.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you’re right, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: About?

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s been happening is the result of the medication, but not the medication the Doctor’s been giving them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, mushrooms aren’t medication. They taste good on hamburgers, but they don’t raise the dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Shamans have used them for centuries to gain entrance to the spirit world.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you’ve been reading too much Carlos Castenada.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ask any anthropologist then.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know --- a shaman gets intoxicated, he has dreams or hallucinations, and he interprets them. I don’t think it’s any more magical than that.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know how else to explain what’s happening here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I think, if anything, these mushrooms are a poison to the system and I think that’s what killed Hal Arden.

speaker: MULDER
line: And raped Michelle Charters and killed those two orderlies? Something’s been unleashed here, Scully. I don’t know how to explain it, but it has something to do with those pills.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: Daddy? Daddy, what are you taking? What are you putting in your mouth?

speaker: DOROTHY
line: Go away! You go away! Go away! You leave me … leave us alone! Go on! You … run. Run while you can. Go on, run. Run. Go away. Go away! Go on. You leave us alone. Go on.

speaker: LEO
line: Dorothy! I need your help!

speaker: DOROTHY
line: Leo …. you leave me alone. You leave him alone! Leo! Leo! Leo … go on. Go on. You leave him …. you leave …..

speaker: DORORTHY
line: Oh … oh, no. Stop. Stop that.

speaker: NURSE CHARTERS
line: Help me, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder! What’s going on!? Mulder!? Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully! Turn off the water main! Turn off the water main!

speaker: SCULLY
line: They’re trapped in the bathroom and it’s filling with water.

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where’s the main water shutoff?

speaker: MS. DAWSON
line: I don’t know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gung will know. Keep trying the door.

speaker: MULDER
line: You’ve got to get up. Come on. You got to get up.

speaker: GUNG
line: It’s stuck.

speaker: SCULLY
line: See if you can find something to force it with.

speaker: GUNG
line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can’t open the drains.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: Please! Please, my father needs help. My father took something. I’m afraid he’s dying.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You stay with him. I’ll get help. Dr. Grago! Dr. Grago.

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: It’s sealed tight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have any atropine in your kit here?

speaker: DOCTOR GREGO
line: Uh, I might. Yes, I think so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stan Phillips has gone into convulsions. I think he might have poisoned himself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just hold on. It’s all right.

speaker: DOROTHY
line: They’re gone. They’re all gone. They’re gone. They’re all gone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You okay, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Fine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In response to the series of unexplained incidents at the Excelsius Dei convalescent home, the Massachusetts Department of Public Health has assumed all administrative authority at the facility. They detected trace amounts of ibotenic acid in more than half the residents tested. Though these levels have dissipated rapidly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. John Grago has been replaced as head physician at the facility and his trial use of the drug Depranil has been suspended. For his admitted part in manufacturing and distributing an illicit substance, Gung Bittouin was remanded to the Immigration and Naturalization Service and is awaiting repatriation to Malaysia. There are reportedly no efforts being made to study the mushrooms.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The federal government has settled Michelle Charters’ lawsuit out of court though no clear blame has been placed. Witnesses to the events have been unreliable due to dramatic relapses and a general reversal in their progress with Alzheimer’s disease.

speaker: STAN’S DAUGHTER
line: I’m going to go now, Daddy. I’ll see you again soon. Maybe next week.
